revised_title: Effects of Nitrogen Sources on Algal-Invertebrate Symbiosis
tldr: This study investigates the effects of exogenous nitrogen sources, such as ammonia, nitrate, and urea, on the growth, photosynthesis, and excretion rates of algal symbionts in both in vitro and in vivo conditions. The research focuses on the symbiosis between the algal species Gymnodinium microadriaticum and the staghorn coral Acropora cervicornis. The results show that ammonia increases the photosynthetic rate and excretion rate of symbionts in vivo and in vitro, while nitrate and urea have no significant effect on these processes.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Ecology and Environmental Science
